snippet: President Obama found himself in the odd position of relying on his Russian counterpart, Vladimir V. Putin, of all people, to bail him out of a predicament partly of his own making.
abstract: News analysis; surprise Russian proposal to defuse the American confrontation with Syria makes a tenuous situation even more volatile for Pres Obama, as he struggles to convince a deeply skeptical public of the need for the United States to respond militarily in yet another Middle Eastern country.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt and Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Obama found himself in the odd position of relying on his Russian counterpart, Vladimir V. Putin, of all people, to bail him out of a predicament partly of his own making.

headline.print_headline: Russian Proposal Catches Obama Between Putin and House Republicans
headline.main: Russian Proposal Could Offer Obama Escape From Bind
